title: Multi-Agent Spec - Agent Definition
description: Schema for defining an AI agent in a multi-agent system

name.description: Unique identifier for the agent (lowercase, hyphenated)

namespace.description: Optional namespace for organizing agents (derived from subdirectory if not specified)

description.description: Brief description of the agent's purpose and capabilities

icon.description: Icon identifier for visual representation. Formats: 'brandkit:name' (from brandkit repo), 'lucide:name' (Lucide icon), or plain name for inference

model.description: Model capability tier (mapped to platform-specific models)

tools.description: List of tools the agent can use

skills.description: List of skills the agent can invoke

dependencies.description: Other agents this agent depends on or can spawn

requires.description: External tools or binaries required (e.g., go, git, golangci-lint)

instructions.description: System prompt / instructions for the agent

tool.description: Canonical tool name (mapped to platform-specific names)

id.description: Unique task identifier within this agent

description.description: What this task validates or accomplishes

command.description: Shell command to execute (for type: command)

pattern.description: Regex pattern to search for (for type: pattern)

file.description: File path to check (for type: file)

files.description: Glob pattern for files to check (for type: pattern)

required.description: If true, task failure causes agent to report NO-GO

human_in_loop.description: When to prompt for human intervention
